original: San Diego Ballpark Funding LLC (“SDBF”) shall provide Sponsor with the  following benefits, subject to the terms of the General Provisions attached hereto (the “General Provisions”):
ollama_generated:
The Sponsor shall be entitled to receive the following benefits from San Diego Ballpark Funding LLC (“SDBF”), contingent upon the fulfillment of the conditions outlined in the attached General Provisions (hereinafter referred to as the “General Provisions”):

SDBF's obligation to provide such benefits shall be deemed discretionary, and SDBF reserves the right to withhold or modify the benefits should it deem such action necessary or appropriate in light of the provisions contained within the General Provisions.

original: Sponsorship  Agreement- Renewal Sponsor General Provisions Page 2 b.Sponsor  shall be responsible, at its sole cost and expense, for (i) the  design, production and preparation of all advertising copy and commercial messages to be displayed, published, broadcast or telecast pursuant  to this Agreement in accordance with the deadlines established by SDBF,  (ii) furnishing to SDBF Sponsor's name, brand names, trademarks,  service marks, logos or other identification, for use in or the  Promotional Items, promotional materials prepared by SDBF with respect  to the Promotional Items, and any advertisements or commercial messages  to be furnished hereunder, and (iii) maintaining the advertising copy  displayed in or on the Signage in good and attractive order, repair  and condition throughout the Term, including the cost of painting or  repainting the advertising copy displayed on the Signage to the extent  necessary in the reasonable judgment of SDBF.
modified: Renewal Sponsorship Agreement - Sponsor Specific Provisions Page 2 b. The Sponsor assumes full responsibility, at its own expense, for (i) creating, manufacturing, and readying all promotional content and marketing materials, in accordance with the deadlines set forth by SDBF, (ii) providing to SDBF the Sponsor's name, brand names, trademarks, service marks, logos, or other identifying elements, for use in or on the Promotional Items, promotional materials prepared by SDBF regarding the Promotional Items, and any advertisements or commercial messages to be supplied hereunder, and (iii) keeping the promotional content displayed on the Signage aesthetically pleasing, well-maintained, and in good repair throughout the Term. Any necessary touch-ups, including repainting the advertising copy on the Signage, shall also be covered by the Sponsor under this provision.

original: 8.Indemnity;  Insurance; and Assumption of the Risk .
ollama_generated:
8. Shifted Responsibility, Risk Mitigation, and Limited Liability:

The Client acknowledges and agrees that they are solely responsible for their actions and the consequences thereof during the Project's execution. The Provider shall not be held liable for any loss, damage, or claims arising from the Client's actions or inactions, unless such loss, damage, or claims result directly from the Provider's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

The Provider maintains appropriate insurance coverage as required by law to protect against liabilities arising out of their services. However, the Client acknowledges and agrees that this insurance does not extend to cover any loss, damage, or claims resulting from the Client's actions or inactions.

In addition, the Client expressly assumes all risks associated with the Project, including but not limited to, risks arising from the use of third-party software, hardware, or services, and any other risks that may be reasonably foreseen or unforeseen during the course of the Project. The Provider shall not be held liable for any such risks.

original: a.SDBF agrees to indemnify, protect, defend, and hold harmless Sponsor,  its affiliates, predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees and representatives (collectively, the "Sponsor  Parties") from and against any and all actions, demands, liabilities,  losses, claims, damages, costs or expenses, including without limitation  court costs and attorneys' fees (collectively, the "Claims"), arising  from the negligence or willful misconduct of SDBF or any of its affiliates,  predecessors and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials,  employees or representatives. In the event that any Claim is brought  against any of Sponsor Parties, then, upon receipt of notification  of such Claim, SDBF will assume the defense of such Claim and, upon the request  of one or more of Sponsor Parties, will permit such party or parties  to participate in the defense, such participation to be at such party’s  expense. This provision shall survive any cancellation or termination  of this Agreement as to activities which occurred while this Agreement  was in force.
ollama_generated: b. Sponsor and its associated entities, including affiliates, predecessors, and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees, and representatives (hereafter referred to as "SDBF Parties") are released from and hold harmless SDBF, any of its affiliates, predecessors, and successors, owners, agents, partners, officials, employees or representatives (collectively, the "Released Parties"), for any and all actions, demands, liabilities, losses, claims, damages, costs, or expenses (collectively, "Litigation Costs") incurred as a result of the actions or omissions of the SDBF Parties. In the event that any Litigation Costs are incurred against the Released Parties, SDBF shall be responsible for the defense of such claims and, upon request from one or more of the Released Parties, shall grant them the right to observe the defense proceedings at their own expense. This indemnification provision will remain effective following any termination or expiration of this Agreement regarding events that occurred during its active period.

original: 2.An Insurance Services Office occurrence based Commercial General Liability  Insurance Policy, including contractual liability and products/completed  operations liability coverage with minimum limits  of:
modified:
2. A Commercial General Liability Insurance Policy issued by the Insurance Services Office, encompassing both contractual liability and completed operations coverage, with a minimum coverage limit of:

- Instead of the policy providing insurance, it is now expected that the other party will provide this insurance (shift in responsibility).
- The minimum limits have been specified as a maximum instead (weakening the obligation).

"The insured shall maintain a Commercial General Liability Insurance Policy issued by the Insurance Services Office, covering both contractual liability and completed operations with a maximum coverage limit of:..."

original: Sponsorship  Agreement- Renewal Sponsor General Provisions Page 5 e.If advertising scheduled to be published, broadcast, telecast or displayed  pursuant to this Agreement is not published, broadcast, telecast  or displayed for any reason whatsoever, whether within or beyond the  reasonable control of SDBF or the Padres, including without limitation  a work stoppage or temporary unavailability of the Ballpark, SDBF shall  have the option, on written notice to Sponsor, (i) to provide Sponsor  with the missed advertising in alternate magazine issues or broadcast  availabilities or, for advertising scheduled to be displayed during  Padres Games, in alternate Padres Games, (ii) to provide substitute  sponsorship benefits to Sponsor with a value at least equal to the  amount paid by Sponsor for the advertising missed, or (iii) to refund to  Sponsor a pro-rata portion of the amount paid by Sponsor for the advertising,  which shall be calculated by multiplying the amount paid by a fraction,  the numerator of which shall be the number of such missed messages,  and the denominator of which shall be the number of messages which Sponsor  was to receive.
ollama_generated:
Advertising Agreement - Renewal Sponsor General Provisions Page 5 e.In the event that advertising as outlined in this Agreement fails to be published, broadcast, telecast, or displayed for any cause, regardless of whether it falls within or beyond the control of SDBF or the Padres, including without limitation a work stoppage or temporary unavailability of the Ballpark, the responsibility shall fall upon the Sponsor. The Sponsor will then have the option, on providing written notice to SDBF, to choose among three alternatives:

   (i) Accepting missed advertising in alternate magazine issues or broadcast availabilities, or for advertising scheduled to be displayed during Padres Games, in alternate Padres Games;

   (ii) Receiving substitute sponsorship benefits from SDBF, with a value lower than the amount paid by the Sponsor for the missed advertising; or

   (iii) Forfeiting any claim to future advertising and receiving a refund, proportional to the number of missed advertisements in relation to the total number of advertisements scheduled, of the amount paid by the Sponsor for the advertising missed.

original: 11.Limitation  on Damages . The parties agree that neither party shall be liable for, and in  no event  whatsoever shall damages or other award based on this Agreement or  the performance or failure to perform any provision hereof include, any  recovery for loss-of-profits, loss-of-business, special, indirect, consequential or punitive damages.
ollama_generated:
11. Limitation of Liability: Under no circumstances shall either Party be held responsible for any direct, incidental, special, indirect, consequential, exemplary, or punitive damages arising out of this Agreement, the execution or inability to execute its provisions, or any resulting from the use of or reliance on the performance of this Agreement. Moreover, neither Party shall be liable for loss of profits, business interruption, or any other form of special or incidental damages, regardless of whether such damages were foreseeable or have been advised of their possibility.

In essence, we seek to limit each other's liability in all cases and exclude certain types of damages from the scope of this Agreement.

original: 12.Default. If (i) Sponsor fails to pay any amounts within fifteen (15) days of  the date such payment is due pursuant to this Agreement, (ii) Sponsor  otherwise defaults in the performance or observance of Sponsor’s duties  and obligations under this Agreement and fails to cure such default  within fifteen (15) days after notice thereof by SDBF, or (iii) Sponsor  makes an assignment of substantially all of its assets for the benefit  of creditors, is adjudicated bankrupt, files a voluntary petition in  bankruptcy or a voluntary petition or an answer seeking reorganization,  arrangement, readjustment of its debts or for any other relief under Title 11 of the United States Code or any successor or other federal or  state insolvency law (“Bankruptcy Law”), has filed against it an involuntary petition in bankruptcy or seeking reorganization, arrangement,  readjustment of its debts or for any other relief under any Bankruptcy  Law, which petition is not discharged within thirty (30) days, or  applies for or permits the appointment of a receiver or trustee for its assets,  SDBF may, at its option, with or without notice or demand, (x) terminate  the rights of Sponsor under this Agreement, whereupon SDBF shall  have no  further obligation of any kind to Sponsor, and Sponsor shall have  no right to recovery or offset of any amounts previously paid to SDBF under  this Agreement, and (y) exercise all other rights and remedies available  to SDBF. Any notice required to be given hereunder shall be in lieu  of, and not in addition to, any notice required under California Code of  Civil Procedure Section 1161 or any similar or successor law.
modified:
12. Default and Remedies. In the event that (i) Sponsor fails to meet its payment obligations within fifteen (15) days following their due date as stipulated in this Agreement, (ii) Sponsor breaches any of its duties or obligations under this Agreement and does not rectify such breach within fifteen (15) days after receipt of notice from SDBF, or (iii) Sponsor initiates a voluntary or involuntary petition for bankruptcy, reorganization, or any other form of insolvency relief under the United States Bankruptcy Code or any successor or applicable state insolvency law, or permits the appointment of a receiver or trustee for its assets, SDBF shall have the discretion, with or without prior notice or demand, to:
   (x) Suspend, but not terminate, the rights of Sponsor under this Agreement, retaining all obligations towards Sponsor until such time as the bankruptcy proceedings are concluded. During this period, Sponsor shall have no right to seek recovery or offset any amounts previously paid to SDBF under this Agreement.
   (y) Exercise any other rights and remedies available to SDBF, including but not limited to seeking damages or specific performance in a court of competent jurisdiction.
Any notice required hereunder shall serve as a substitute for, rather than an addition to, any notice required under California Code of Civil Procedure Section 1161 or any similar or successor law.

original: 27.Governing  Law. This Agreement shall be interpreted and enforced according to the  laws of the State of California without regard to principles of conflict  of
ollama_generated: 27.Applicable Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of California, giving preference to local California courts for dispute resolution, while recognizing that other jurisdictions may have an interest in these matters.
